property.name: bounds
property.doc: Bounds of IrMaster window.

property.name: plotBounds
property.doc: Bounds of IrMaster plot window.

property.name: disregardRepeatMins
property.doc: Value of the "disregard repeat mins" parameter. See IrpMaster documentation for the semantic.

property.name: exportdir
property.doc: Directory to which to write exports.

property.name: exportFormatFile
property.doc: Filename of a file consisting of export format descriptions.

property.name: globalcacheIpName
property.doc: IP Name or Address of GlobalCache to use.

property.name: globalcacheModule
property.doc: Module number of Global Cache to use, see its documentation.

property.name: globalcachePort
property.doc: IR Port number of selected Global Cache module, see Global Cache documenation.

property.name: globalcacheTimeOut
property.doc: Socket timeout for Global Cache

property.name: hardwareIndex
property.doc: System dependent semantics.

property.name: helpfileUrl
property.doc: URL for help file.

property.name: irTransIpName
property.doc: IP name or address of IRTrans unit.

property.name: irTransPort
property.doc: IRTrans port to use.

property.name: irpmasterConfigfile
property.doc: Filename of IrpProtocols.ini

property.name: irpmasterUrl
property.doc: URL of IrpMaster documentation.

property.name: lircIpName
property.doc: IP name or address of LIRC server.

property.name: lircPort
property.doc: TCP port number of LIRC sserver, typically 8765.

property.name: lookAndFeel
property.doc: Look and feel, as integer index in table. Semantics is system dependent.

property.name: makehexIrpdir
property.doc: Directory of Makehex IRP files.

property.name: outputFormat
property.doc: System dependant syntax.

property.name: pingTimeout
property.doc: Ping timeout in milli seconds.

property.name: protocol
property.doc: Protocol name, as in IrpProtocols.ini

property.name: usePopupsForErrors
property.doc: If true, use popups for help. Otherwise the console will be used.

property.doc: If true, use popups for help. Otherwise the console will be used.
